result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Max W. Thompson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Max W. Thompson in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CT-36, 15CM-69 and 15CM-277.

11:10 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement but 15CM-277 is a new file, is on the calendar today for an initial appearance, it is anticipated that this case will be dismissed.

15CM-277:
Initial Appearance
Atty Barkley received a copy of the complaint, waives reading.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Defendant will plead to 15CT-36. Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3. Count 2 will be dismissed. 15CM-69 will be dismised. 15CM-277 will be dismissed.

State recommends guidelines.

Defense is free to argue.
Atty Barkley concurs
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.


Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST Count 1 15CT-36
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3 15CT-36

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Barkley for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CT-36 Count 1: OWI 3rd offense
15CT-36 Count 2: Dismissed
15CT-36 Count 3: Operating After Revocation
15CM-69: Dismiss and Read In
15CM-277: Dismiss and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests a one category reduction.

Court takes a moment to review the pretrial supervision report.

BY THE COURT:
15CT-36:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 90 Days
0 Jail Days Credit
Huber granted for work and counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Defendant may serve one half on electronic monitor if Defendant qualifies by going through the assessment through the Sheriff's Department
Jail sentence to commence TODAY. Defendant is remanded to the Sheriff's Department
Pay a fine and costs totaling $3,214
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Drivers Licence Revoked 33 Months, effective TODAY
Revocation is retroactive to date of administrative suspension
IID 33 Months, effective TODAY
DOT Assessment  and comply with safety plan BAC: .207

Count 3:
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

Any Bond posted in 15CT-36 and 15CM-69 and 15CM-277 may be applied to the fines/costs in 15CT-36.

Atty Barkley addresses the Court regarding MBH AODA assessment.
Court returns medical records to Atty Barkley.
Court replies.
